justification: Participants reported their confidence by moving a marker on a scale labelled from ‘unsure’ to ‘sure’; these analogue ratings were subsequently binned into a five-level discrete variable for analysis.

Experiment 1 employed a masked orientation discrimination task in which participants judged horizontal vs. vertical gratings; accuracy, reaction time and confidence from this task were analysed as indicators of decision performance.
Experiment 2 used a motion direction discrimination task with varying motion coherence, and the resulting choice, reaction time and confidence data served as the measure of decision performance.
